          connect is used by a client to open a TCP/IP connection between a pair of applications with intentions not defined.

          disconnect closes any connection to a remote host.

          getInputStream returns the input stream object for this connection.

          getOutputStream returns the output stream object for this connection.
 boolean AbstractCommManager.listen(int port)
          listen sets this communication manager up as a server listening on a specified port for client's request to connect.
 boolean AbstractCommManager.listen(int port, int timeout)
          The overloaded listen method sets this communication manager up as a server listening on a specified port for client's request to connect and does so for only a specified amount of time.
 java.lang.Object AbstractCommManager.receive()
          receive is called in an asychronous form of communication to receive Serializable objects from the remote object over the established connection.
 void AbstractCommManager.send(java.io.Serializable message)
          send sends a Serializable object to a remote object over the established connection.

          disconnect attempts to close a connection between this application and an application running on a remote host.
